text:
I get the error below when trying to label a branch in
StarTeam.  Looking at the code for StarTeamLabel on line 148 you can see
that it is not trying to label the existing view, but get a view of the
view at a certain time and then apply a label to that.  If I have
createSnapshotView() return the view its passed (so I don't create a view of
a view) I can label fine though.

A view can only be modified from its current configuration.
        at
com.starbase.starteam.vts.comm.BinaryCommand.popException
(BinaryCommand.java:643)
        at com.starbase.starteam.vts.comm.Command.pop(Command.java:303)
        at
com.starbase.starteam.vts.comm.BinaryCommand.readInt(BinaryCommand.java:183)
        at
com.starbase.starteam.LabelRWImpl.readGutsForCreation(LabelRWImpl.java:35)
        at
com.starbase.starteam.CmdCreateLabel.pop(CmdCreateLabel.java:32)
        at
com.starbase.starteam.vts.comm.CommandMacro.execute(CommandMacro.java:107)
        at
com.starbase.starteam.PutMethods$3.createNewLabel(PutMethods.java:148)
        at com.starbase.starteam.PutMethods$3.execute(PutMethods.java:103)
        at com.starbase.starteam.PutMethods.put(PutMethods.java:509)
        at com.starbase.starteam.PutMethods.put(PutMethods.java:503)
        at com.starbase.starteam.Server.putItems(Server.java:440)
        at com.starbase.starteam.Label.update(Label.java:548)
        at
org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.starteam.StarTeamLabel.execute
(StarTeamLabel.java:135)
creator: scott@ragingkegger.com

text:
Scott, like most (all?) other committers, I don't use starteam at all - and your
description is close to Bavarian to me (every now and then I seem to recognize
a word ;-).

If it is clear to you, what is wrong, maybe you could provide a patch?
creator: bodewig@apache.org
scott@ragingkegger.com
text:
Thanks for reminding me.  I meant to create a proposed patch, but at the time I 
didn't know how to do it and then I was busy with other stuff and forgot about 
it.  Not sure what I should do at this point though to get the patch reviewed.

Scott -I have looked into this and I find I cannot replicate your results.  I am allowed to create a label using the code as it presently is.Can you post the exact target you are trying to build?  What version of StarTeam are you working with.  What version of the starteam sdk?
creator: stevec@ignitesports.com

text:
I ran into this problem using StarTeam 4.2 and the SDK 5.1.2.  I was trying to 
label a view (branch) of the existing code.  So maybe create a view (and there 
are some 'branch ...' checkboxes/radio buttons you need to use when creating 
this) and you will be able to replicate.
creator: scott@ragingkegger.com
scott@ragingkegger.com
text:
Steve, 

I was wondering if you had a chance to try to test the StarTeam label task on a 
branched view of some code.  That is the type of environment I was in when I 
ran into this bug.

creator: mkatz@destinyhealth.com

text:
There have been some changes made since this bug was originally submitted and
since 1.5.  Users should try to build from the latest sources if they want these
fixes.

I have not had a chance to check with version 5.2, so would welcome further
reports on this.

Not sure what you mean here:
>>Also I was wondering what version of the sdk did the Label become deprecated,
cause ant uses Label and my docs say to use a method in the View class.

I don't think label as a class has been deprecated but some of the constructors
were, if I recall correctly.  However the version of the docs that I had offered
no guidance as to what the recommended way to do it was, so I left the
deprecated method in

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 14006 ***
creator: stevec@ignitesports.com
